intro: Anogra trichocalyx, commonly known as the velvet leaf or velvet tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are borne in clusters. Anogra trichocalyx is often grown for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures.
